DOC.brief_summary: The objective study evaluate compare two different post-surgical rehabilitation strategy , Rehabilitation supervise physical therapist include exercise progressive early activation rotator cuff versus basic home exercise regard shoulder function , pain , health relate quality life return work arthroscopic subacromial decompression .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Supervised Physical Therapy With Early Activation Rotator Cuff Versus Home Exercises Patients After Arthroscopic Subacromial Decompression
DOC.detailed_description: Patients schedule surgery ( arthroscopic subacromial decompression ) age 25-65 offer participate study . After surgery randomize either Supervised Physical therapy early activation rotator cuff ( PT-group ) home exercise ( H-group ) . Patients PT group meet physical therapist twice week exercise visit exercise home daily . The H-group home exercise daily . Shoulder function pain ( primary outcome ) health relate quality life , return work ( secondary outcome ) assess surgery , one week ( baseline ) , 1,2,3 6 month surgery independent physical therapist .
DOC.criteria: Subacromial impingement verify Neer impingement test At least 6 month duration pain Treated primary care without satisfactory result least three month . Typical history pain location . Scheduled surgery ( subacromial decompression ) Three four test must positive : Neer impingement test HawkinsKennedy impingement sign Jobe supraspinatus test Painful arc 60120 degree Radiological finding malignancy osteoarthritis , fracture Polyarthritis fibromyalgia Pathological hyper laxity Lack communication skill prevent use outcome measurement Cervical spine pathology
